alert.note: Alert for Elliott; Lee; Morgan; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 30 at 2:37PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central Kentucky, south central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following areas, in east central Kentucky, Bath, Elliott, Estill, Fleming, Menifee, Montgomery, Powell and Rowan. In south central Kentucky, Pulaski, Rockcastle and Wayne. In southeast Kentucky, Jackson, Lee, Morgan and Wolfe. * WHEN...From late Friday night through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of creeks and streams. Additionally, isolated flash flooding will be possible if locations see repeated rounds of heavier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Moderate to heavy rainfall is expected to develop along a stalled frontal boundary Friday night and continue into Saturday evening. Widespread rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are forecast, with locally higher amounts possible if embedded thunderstorms track repeatedly across the same locations. At this time, the higher rainfall amounts are forecast across the I-64 corridor. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
